beyond.translation[0].definitions[0].def: on or to the further side of something
beyond.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
beyond.translation[0].definitions[1].def: later than a particular time, date etc
beyond.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: What changes await us in the coming year and beyond?
The ban has been extended beyond 2003.
The disco went on until beyond midnight.
beyond.translation[0].definitions[2].def: more or greater than a particular amount, level, or limit
beyond.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: More people are choosing to work beyond retirement age.
Inflation has risen beyond the 5% level.
beyond.translation[0].definitions[3].def: outside the range or limits of something or someone
beyond.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Such tasks are far beyond the scope of the average schoolkid.
expensive luxuries that are beyond the reach of ordinary people
beyond.translation[0].definitions[4].def: used to say that something is impossible to do
beyond.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Scott’s equipment was damaged beyond repair.
The town centre had changed beyond all recognition.
Due to circumstances beyond our control, the performance has had to be cancelled.
beyond.translation[0].definitions[5].def: used to mean ‘except’ in negative sentences
beyond.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Fred owns nothing beyond the clothes on his back.
